moves.1. e4: i am sure on the name of this opening i bet someone will tell me it eventually but it was smooth sailing. i was goin for a king, bishops gambit my favorite set up but i was forced to do it solo.
moves.1... c6: not the answer i wanted but not a burden either
moves.2. f4 d5: nothing big still i figur ill take a traditional king's gambit set up and adept it
moves.3. d3 Nf6: well i know that nc3 is not a good move here so i figure more pawn moves
moves.4. e5 Nfd7: well this helps now, i can catch up on developement.
moves.6. Nf3: just putting pieces out into the center
moves.9... c4: this hurts, now my bishops both suck.
moves.10... Bxc3 11. Qxc3: this helps atleast the queen can get around
moves.11... a5 12. Be2: maybe try going the other way.
moves.14. b4 axb4: this series of moves was all i wanted and needed now my rooks can take the express route into the game.
moves.18... exf4 19. Bd2: my pieces are getting pushed around
moves.22... Nxc2: oh my she has  no nice squares well i got a last ditch idea here.
moves.25. Be5: guard it and set up the future
moves.25... Nf6 26. Qh6: now my last ditch is becoming a future mate
moves.26... Nf5: ouch nice fork too bad you will not get it.
moves.27... Kg8 28. Qg6+: forces the end of the game
moves.28... Ng7 29. Qxg7#: i really enjoyed how my last dicth attempt became the winning move.
